The current advisory is well over a year old, making a periodic, scheduled review highly likely. The security situation has not improved; if anything, the withdrawal of US and French forces has created a greater security vacuum, and risks from terrorism and kidnapping persist. This makes a downgrade to a lower level of advisory extremely improbable. Thus, any review will almost certainly result in a reaffirmation of the Level 4 status. My forecast is not lower because the combination of a volatile security situation, which could trigger an event-driven update at any moment, and the high likelihood of a scheduled review taking place soon makes an update before July 1 more likely than not. I would raise my probability if a significant security incident occurs in Niger, such as a major attack or kidnapping of a foreigner. I would lower my probability if it were revealed that a comprehensive review had just been completed in April 2025.
